sub_title: Supply Chain & Manufacturing in the Process Industry
summary:
Builder interested to create structure in processes and organizations.
Critical and analytical. 
Aiming at structural improvement. 
I am a team player who believes in inclusivity and transparency.
Give direction & delegate responsibility down to chose able to carry it. 
People focused and loyal, but also make the inevitable people decisions. 

I believe in a transparent &  integrated supply chain. Internal integration between S/C, manufacturing, finance, sales and marketing/product development is key, but also external, with strategic third parties. Creating cross functionally integrated processes that fully utilize IT functionality is essential to optimize effectiveness and efficiency of the supply chain.

I tend to research new subjects thoroughly to get sufficient understanding to base my decisions on.

Have experience in a variety of area’s in the technological/chemical industry, especially in the supply chain /operations / manufacturing area. 
I was involved in acquisitions and acted three times in different roles in the implementation of an Operational IT system, including a global SAP implementation in Ashland in 2006 - 2007. 

I am interested in the process- and people aspects in- and around major changes like IT implementation projects or integration processes after mergers / acquisitions.

Focus area's:
- Supply Chain
- Purchasing
- Manufacturing
- Environmental Health & Safety
- Quality Assurance / Quality Systems 
- Process Development & Implementation

Industries:
- Process Industry
- Chemical / Speciality Chemical
- Trade

profile_positions.description:
Accountabilities:
- Performance of the Drew Marine supply- and delivery chain.
- Local de-merger from Ashland Inc. and set-up of the Drew Marine Barendrecht office .
Responsibilities:
- Operational and strategic purchasing
- Management of toll-manufacturing contracts.
- Regional inventory planning.
- Management of  third party storage and delivery network consisting of 29 logistics locations in EMEA. 
- Management ofowned warehouse in Hamburg.
- Local Safety, Health and Environment performance, operational compliance and product registration. The latter for amongst others ozone depleting substances (EU ODS), biocides (EU BPD), hazardous products (Norway) and precursors for drugs. 
Achievements:
- Established office in Barendrecht, set-up of back office functions HR, Finance, Law and Office Management for the region in cooperation with the functional leads in our corporate HQ in New Jersey (USA)  and prior mother company Ashland in Barendrecht. 
- Successful initiation and implementation of new logistics partner contracts in the Netherlands (regional buffer stock- and Benelux delivery partner, realizing a saving of 40% on cost with a comparable delivery performance), Spain, UK, Denmark, Greece, France, Turkey. In all cases we realized the project objectives on cost savings and/or performance.   
- Was involved from an operations perspective in specification and implementation of JDE transactional system. 
- Implementation of the EU Ozone Depleting Substance directive and its several stages. Regular contacts with Dutch and EC representatives concerning this regulation, issues and required reporting. Successful passing of audits by the Dutch Inspectorate, building a constructive relationship with the inspectorate and the European Commission.
- Full review study of mega site option, including alternative locations, BRZO review, etc. in close cooperation with Steder Group and ProDelta Real Estate. 
- Execution and follow-up of EH&S audits at third party providers.
